required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Immunogenicity and Safety of GSK Biologicals' Infanrix-IPV/Hib Vaccine Administered as a Three-dose Vaccination Course at 3, 4.5 and 6 Months of Age and a Booster Dose at 18 Months of Age in Healthy Infants in Russia
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of GSK Biologicals' Combined Diphtheria-tetanus-acellular Pertussis-inactivated Poliovirus and Haemophilus Influenzae Type b (DTPa-IPV/Hib) Conjugate Vaccine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the immune response, safety and reactogenicity after receiving combined DTPa-IPV/Hib vaccine when administered as a three-dose primary vaccination course at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and as a booster dose at 18 months of age in Russian healthy children according to the Russian immunisation schedule

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) and Anti-tetanus (Anti-T), Post Primary Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-D and anti-T antibody concentration was greater than or equal to (≥) 0.1 International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-poliovirus Types 1, 2 and 3, Post Primary Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-poliovirus types 1, 2 and 3 antibody titer was ≥ 8 ED50.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-polyribosyl Ribitol Phosphate (Anti-PRP), Post Primary Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
primary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-PRP antibody concentration was ≥ 0.15 micrograms per milliliter (µg/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti-pertussis (Anti- PT), Anti-filamentous Haemagglutinin (Anti-FHA) and Anti-pertactin (Anti-PRN), Post Primary Vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
primary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject is a subject whose antibody concentration was ≥ 2.046 IU/mL for anti-FHA, ≥ 2.187 IU/mL for anti-PRN and ≥ 2.693 IU/mL for anti-PT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-D and Anti-T, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-D and anti-T antibody concentration was ≥ 0.1 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-poliovirus Types 1, 2 and 3, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-poliovirus types 1, 2 and 3 antibody titer was ≥ 8 ED50.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-PRP, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-PRP antibody concentration was ≥ 0.15 µg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti- PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: A seropositive subject is a subject whose antibody concentration was ≥ 2.046 IU/mL for anti-FHA, ≥ 2.187 IU/mL for anti-PRN and ≥ 2.693 IU/mL for anti-PT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-D and Anti-T, Post Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-D and anti-T were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed as IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-D and Anti-T, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-D and anti-T were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed as IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Titers for Anti-polio Types 1, 2 and 3, Post Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody titers for anti-polio types 1, 2 and 3 were presented as geometric mean titres (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Titers for Anti-polio Types 1, 2 and 3, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody titers for anti-polio types 1, 2 and 3 were presented as geometric mean titres (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentration for Anti-PRP, Post Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PRP were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed as µg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentration for Anti-PRP, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PRP were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed as µg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN, Post Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN were presented as GMCs and expressed as IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN, Post Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN were presented as GMCs and expressed as IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local Adverse Events (AEs) Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after each primary vaccination dose (i.e. at Day 0, at Month 1.5 and at Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The solicited local AEs assessed were pain, redness and swelling at injection site. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local AEs Following Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after booster vaccination dose (i.e. at Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: The solicited local AEs assessed were pain, redness and swelling at injection site. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited General AEs Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after each primary vaccination dose (i.e. at Day 0, at Month 1.5 and at Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The solicited general AEs assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade. Any fever = Fever (axillary) ≥ 37.5°C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited General AEs Following Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after booster vaccination dose (i.e. at Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: The solicited general AEs assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade. Any fever = Fever (axillary) ≥ 37.5°C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow-up period after each primary vaccination dose (i.e. at Day 0, at Month 1.5 and at Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE was defined as any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited AE with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited AEs. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Following Booster Vaccination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow-up period after booster vaccination dose (i.e. at Month 15)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE was defined as any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited AE with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited AEs. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (i.e. from Day 0 until Month 16)
secondary_outcome.description: The SAEs assessed included any untoward medical occurrences that resulted in death, were life threatening, required hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation or resulted in disability/incapacity. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.

arm_group.description: All subjects receive three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, Infanrix-IPV/Hib (DTPa-IPV/Hib), at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine is administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

intervention.description: Subjects receive Infanrix-IPV/Hib three-dose primary vaccination course at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a booster dose at 18 months of age. The vaccine is administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects' parent(s)/Legally Acceptable Representatives [LARs] who, in the opinion of the investigator, can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female child between 3 and 4 months of age at the time of the first vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the parents/LARs of the subject prior to performing any study specific procedure.
- Healthy subjects as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study.
- Born full-term.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child in care
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccine during the period starting 30 days before the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- Any medical condition that in the judgment of the investigator would make intramuscular injection unsafe.
- Chronic administration of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs during the period starting since birth. For corticosteroids, this will mean prednisone ≥ 0.5 mg/kg/day, or equivalent. Inhaled and topical steroids are allowed.
- Administration of long-acting immune-modifying drugs at any time during the study period
- Planned administration/administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol in the period starting 30 days before the first dose and ending 30 days after the last dose of vaccine administration, with the exception of hepatitis B and other vaccines given as part of the national immunisation schedule and as part of routine vaccination practice, that are allowed at any time during the study period. Seasonal or pandemic influenza vaccine can be given at any time during the study, and according to the Summary of Product Characteristics and national recommendations.
- Concurrently participating in another clinical study, at any time during the study period, in which the subject has been or will be exposed to an investigational or a non-investigational vaccine/product
- Previous vaccination against diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, poliomyelitis and Hib diseases.
- History of diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, poliomyelitis and Hib diseases.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition, based on medical history and physical examination.
- Family history of congenital or hereditary immunodeficiency.
- History of any reaction or hypersensitivity likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine.
- Major congenital defects.
- Serious chronic illness.
- History of any neurological disorders or seizures.
- Acute disease and/or fever at the time of enrolment.
- Fever is defined as temperature ≥37.5°C for oral, axillary or tympanic route, or ≥38.0°C for rectal route.
- Subjects with a minor illness without fever may be enrolled at the discretion of the investigator.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products since birth or planned administration during the study period.

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD for this study will be made available via the Clinical Study Data Request site.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD will be made available within 6 months of publishing the results of the primary endpoints of the study.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access is provided after a research proposal is submitted and has received approval from the Independent Review Panel and after a Data Sharing Agreement is in place. Access is provided for an initial period of 12 months but an extension can be granted, when justified, for up to another 12 months.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, Infanrix-IPV/Hib (DTPa-IPV/Hib), at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Number of Seroprotected Subjects for Anti-diphtheria (Anti-D) and Anti-tetanus (Anti-T), Post Primary Vaccination
outcome.description: A seroprotected subject is a subject whose anti-D and anti-T antibody concentration was greater than or equal to (≥) 0.1 International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
outcome.population: The According-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the primary epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after Dose 3.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Antibody Titers for Anti-polio Types 1, 2 and 3, Post Booster Vaccination
measure.description: The antibody titers for anti-polio types 1, 2 and 3 were presented as geometric mean titres (GMTs).
measure.population: The ATP cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the booster epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after the booster dose.

outcome.title: Antibody Concentration for Anti-PRP, Post Primary Vaccination
outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PRP were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed as µg/mL.
outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
outcome.population: The According-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the primary epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after Dose 3.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Antibody Concentration for Anti-PRP, Post Primary Vaccination
measure.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PRP were presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed as µg/mL.
measure.population: The According-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the primary epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after Dose 3.

outcome.time_frame: At Month 16 (i.e. one month after booster vaccination)
outcome.population: The ATP cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the booster epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after the booster dose.

measure.population: The ATP cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the booster epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after the booster dose.

outcome.title: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN, Post Primary Vaccination
outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN were presented as GMCs and expressed as IU/mL.
outcome.time_frame: At Month 4 (i.e. one month after 3rd dose of primary vaccination)
outcome.population: The According-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the primary epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after Dose 3.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN, Post Primary Vaccination
measure.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN were presented as GMCs and expressed as IU/mL.
measure.population: The According-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the primary epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after Dose 3.

outcome.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN were presented as GMCs and expressed as IU/mL.

outcome.population: The ATP cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the booster epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after the booster dose.

group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Antibody Concentrations for Anti-PT, Anti-FHA and Anti-PRN, Post Booster Vaccination
measure.description: The antibody concentrations for anti-PT, anti-FHA and anti-PRN were presented as GMCs and expressed as IU/mL.
measure.population: The ATP cohort for analysis of immunogenicity of the booster epoch included all evaluable subjects who complied with protocol and for whom assay results were available for antibodies against at least one study vaccine antigen component one month after the booster dose.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local Adverse Events (AEs) Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
outcome.description: The solicited local AEs assessed were pain, redness and swelling at injection site. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after each primary vaccination dose (i.e. at Day 0, at Month 1.5 and at Month 3)
outcome.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local Adverse Events (AEs) Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
measure.description: The solicited local AEs assessed were pain, redness and swelling at injection site. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
measure.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local AEs Following Booster Vaccination
outcome.description: The solicited local AEs assessed were pain, redness and swelling at injection site. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after booster vaccination dose (i.e. at Month 15)
outcome.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with at least one booster vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited Local AEs Following Booster Vaccination
measure.description: The solicited local AEs assessed were pain, redness and swelling at injection site. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
measure.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with at least one booster vaccine dose administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited General AEs Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
outcome.description: The solicited general AEs assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade. Any fever = Fever (axillary) ≥ 37.5°C.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after each primary vaccination dose (i.e. at Day 0, at Month 1.5 and at Month 3)
outcome.population: TVC for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited General AEs Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
measure.description: The solicited general AEs assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade. Any fever = Fever (axillary) ≥ 37.5°C.
measure.population: TVC for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited General AEs Following Booster Vaccination
outcome.description: The solicited general AEs assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade. Any fever = Fever (axillary) ≥ 37.5°C.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after booster vaccination dose (i.e. at Month 15)
outcome.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with at least one booster vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Solicited General AEs Following Booster Vaccination
measure.description: The solicited general AEs assessed were drowsiness, irritability/fussiness, loss of appetite and fever. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade. Any fever = Fever (axillary) ≥ 37.5°C.
measure.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with at least one booster vaccine dose administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE was defined as any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited AE with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited AEs. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow-up period after each primary vaccination dose (i.e. at Day 0, at Month 1.5 and at Month 3)
outcome.population: TVC for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Following Each Dose of Primary Vaccination
measure.description: An unsolicited AE was defined as any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited AE with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited AEs. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
measure.population: TVC for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Following Booster Vaccination
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE was defined as any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited AE with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited AEs. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow-up period after booster vaccination dose (i.e. at Month 15)
outcome.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with at least one booster vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Following Booster Vaccination
measure.description: An unsolicited AE was defined as any AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited AE with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited AEs. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
measure.population: Total vaccinated cohort (TVC) for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with at least one booster vaccine dose administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: The SAEs assessed included any untoward medical occurrences that resulted in death, were life threatening, required hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation or resulted in disability/incapacity. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (i.e. from Day 0 until Month 16)
outcome.population: TVC for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented, and TVC for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with the booster vaccine dose administration documented.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: The SAEs assessed included any untoward medical occurrences that resulted in death, were life threatening, required hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation or resulted in disability/incapacity. Any = Occurrence of the AE regardless of the intensity grade.
measure.population: TVC for analysis of safety of the primary epoch: all subjects with at least one primary vaccine dose administration documented, and TVC for analysis of safety of the booster epoch: all subjects with the booster vaccine dose administration documented.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local & general AEs: during the 4-day (Days 0-3) follow-up period after each primary & booster vaccination. Unsolicited AEs: during the 31-day (Days 0-30) follow-up period after each primary & booster vaccination. SAEs: from Day 0 until Month 16.
reported_events.desc: Solicited local and general AEs, unsolicited AEs, and SAEs were reported for the Primary Epoch and for the Booster Epoch.

group.title: DTPa-IPV/Hib Group
group.description: All subjects received three doses of primary vaccination of the study vaccine, DTPa-IPV/Hib, at 3, 4.5 and 6 months of age and a single dose of booster vaccination at 18 months of age. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly into the upper side of the thigh on the right/left side.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
